abstract: Patients taking the drug anacetrapib had a 39.8 percent reduction in bad cholesterol and a 138.1 percent increase in good cholesterol.
snippet: Patients taking the drug anacetrapib had a 39.8 percent reduction in bad cholesterol and a 138.1 percent increase in good cholesterol.
lead_paragraph: Merck has a potential blockbuster in anacetrapib, an experimental cholesterol drug that increases HDL, or “good” cholesterol even as it lowers LDL, the “bad” cholesterol.

headline.main: Merck Drug for Cutting Cholesterol Is Promising
headline.print_headline: Merck Drug For Cutting Cholesterol Is Promising
